content.raw:
In all likelihood we will use g2.2xlarge on AWS for the finals.

I wouldn't spend a lot of money on expensive hardware. Throwing more compute at simulation will achieve only marginal benefits. We are trying to improve performance, but there are a many non-trivial factors to account for. It's unlikely we'll get to a real time factor of 1.0.

For reference we also see a real time factor of roughly 0.31.
